spanGrp.span: Alexander tames the horse Bucephalus
Alexander takes up arms for the first time
Alexander confronts his father about him betraying his mother
Alexander retakes the city of "Antonia"
The dispute over tributes between Philip / Alexander and Darius is introduced
Alexander quells the revolt in Thelemone
Philip dies from the wounds inflicted by Pausonias
Alexander becomes king and addresses his people about the tribute
Alexander sends messengers to other lands to demand help against Darius
Alexander's expedition in Sicily and to the Romans
Alexander subdues Carthage
Alexander goes to Egypt and founds the city of Alexandria
Alexander conquers cities and regions in the Holy Land
The city of Tyre is described
Alexander tries to bend Tyre to his will
Alexander's first attack against Tyre fails because the city pushes his army back
Alexander gets tree trunks for the siege but is hindered by the Arabs
Tyre goes for revenge with a counterattack
Alexander's dukes try to attack again without success
Alexander manages to breach the first walls
Alexander breaches the second walls and kills the sire of the city
Alexander violently battles inside the city
Tyre tries not to succumb
Alexander is advised to use Greek fire
Tyre finally falls
A survivor from Tyre tells King Darius what happened to the city
Darius sends Alexander a letter and three mocking gifts
Alexander reacts to and interprets the gifts
Alexander sends a threatening letter to Darius
Darius furiously reacts to Alexander's provocation
Darius asks two of his dukes to push Alexander back
The dukes critices Darius's approach to Alexander's campaign
Darius sends another duke against Alexander
Darius threatens the dukes into taking action
The dukes finally resolve to gather their men
Alexander meets the dukes' men at the ford and attacks
Alexander fights against the duke Mennes
A knight called "Daclym" saves Alexander from an attack
Alexander resumes his ferocious fighting
Alexander fights against the count Pincun to retake his stolen banner and decapitates him
Alexander kills Mennes in battle and the Persians stop fighting
Alexander takes the city of Sardis, which belonged to Darius
Darius swears to take revenge against Alexander and kill him
Darius rallies his subordinates from many different lands
